New Records: Quinton de Kock equalled Aaron Jones for the fastest half-century of the tournament with a fifty off 22 balls.
Key Match Events: Anrich Nortje successfully defended 13 runs in the final over in a tense finish.
Kagiso Rabada had Liam Livingstone caught at deep backward square off a full toss.
Marco Jansen bowled a phenomenal penultimate over, conceding only seven runs.
Jofra Archer took 3 wickets for 40 runs.
Keshav Maharaj took 2 wickets for 25 runs.
Kagiso Rabada took 2 wickets for 32 runs.
Aiden Markram took a crucial catch in the final over to dismiss Harry Brook.
Pre-Game Insights: England's planning against Quinton de Kock involved opening the bowling with Reece Topley and Moeen Ali, who have had success against him in the past.
Post-Match Reflections: England may not be too unhappy after the close defeat, with impressive performances from their spinners Moeen Ali and Adil Rashid, and Reece Topley.
Harry Brook brought up his first T20 World Cup fifty.
England will still fancy their chances of reaching the semi-final with a positive net run rate and a game against the USA to come.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch was slower-than-expected, affecting team selection and performance.
South Africa remained unbeaten in the T20 World Cup 2024.
Jos Buttler's brilliant fielding included a one-handed catch to dismiss Quinton de Kock and a run-out of Heinrich Klaasen.
Reeza Hendricks took a spectacular catch to dismiss Phil Salt.
Anrich Nortje took a stunning catch to dismiss Jonny Bairstow.
Keshav Maharaj bowled out his overs early, leaving the seamers to defend in the final overs.
